trans-unit.source: Selects the remoting surrogate that can be used to serialize an object that derives from a <xref href="System.MarshalByRefObject"></xref>.
A surrogate is an object that can handle the serialization requirements of an object.
Remoting surrogates handle remoting serialization requirements of objects that derive from <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject>.

The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.RemotingSurrogateSelector> manages registered surrogates for use by the <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Binary.BinaryFormatter> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.Formatters.Soap.SoapFormatter>.

During serialization for remoting purposes of a <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject>, the remoting surrogate creates an <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef> that contains all the relevant information required to activate and communicate with the remote object.
The newly created <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef> can then be sent to a remote location and used to create a proxy.
This class makes a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level.
A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have infrastructure permission.
For details about security demands, see [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) and [Inheritance Demands](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28b9adbb-8f08-4f10-b856-dbf59eb932d9).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.RemotingSurrogateSelector"></xref> class.
Adds the specified <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> to the surrogate selector chain.
Remoting surrogates are arranged in chains that are attached to an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.RemotingSurrogateSelector>.
Each chain contains the remoting surrogates that the surrogate selector checks to find a compatible surrogate for a given object type.
The current method adds a new remoting surrogate selector to the surrogate chain that is examined for compatible surrogates.
The next <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> to examine.

Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.MessageSurrogateFilter"></xref> delegate for the current instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.RemotingSurrogateSelector"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.MessageSurrogateFilter"></xref> delegate for the current instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.RemotingSurrogateSelector"></xref>.
Returns the next <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> in the chain of surrogate selectors.
The next <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> in the chain of surrogate selectors.
Returns the object at the root of the object graph.
The object at the root of the object graph.
Returns the appropriate surrogate for the given type in the given context.
A remoting surrogate handles the remoting serialization requirements of an object that derives from a <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject>.

During serialization of an object that derives from <xref:System.MarshalByRefObject> to a remote location, the remoting surrogate creates an <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef> that contains all the relevant information required to activate and communicate with the remote object.
The newly created <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.ObjRef> can then be sent to a remote location and used to create a proxy.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> for which the surrogate is requested.
The source or destination of serialization.
When this method returns, contains an <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.ISurrogateSelector"></xref> that is appropriate for the specified object type.
This parameter is passed uninitialized.
The appropriate surrogate for the given type in the given context.
Sets the object at the root of the object graph.
The object at the root of the object graph.
The obj parameter is `null`.
Sets up the current surrogate selector to use the SOAP format.
The current method is used with the SOAP formatter sinks.
